value: aava_1.0_score
description

The two metadata versions represent the same conceptual workflow model with significant structural evolution and moderate governance degradation. AAVA 2.0 introduces a more normalized schema with enhanced agent identification but removes critical output specifications.
Core workflow concept preserved: both versions define a 3-agent data integration pipeline for technical specifications, model changes, and test cases.
Agent purposes remain semantically identical: DI_Data_Technical_Specification_SN, DI_Delta_Model_Changes_SN, and DI_Functional_Test_Cases_SN maintain same business functions.
Major structural reorganization: workflowId/workflowName flattened to workFlowDetail object with id/name properties.
Container rename: nodes array renamed to workflowAgents, indicating semantic evolution toward agent-centric model.
Workflow identifier changed: workflowId (1594) to workFlowDetail.id (2147), indicating version progression.
Workflow name evolved: workflowName to workFlowDetail.name with formatting change from underscore to space separation.
Agent identification enhanced: agentName replaced with agentId (numeric) + name combination for better referential integrity.
Model specification updated: model field renamed to modelDeploymentName with version upgrade from gpt-4 to gpt-4.1.
Tool reference structure changed: tools array replaced with toolReferences array, currently empty in v2.
Critical metadata loss: task wrapper object completely removed in AAVA 2.0, eliminating structured task definitions.
Expected output specifications removed: expectedOutput field absent in AAVA 2.0, reducing governance and validation capability.
Metadata quality degradation: removal of expectedOutput reduces contract clarity and downstream system integration guidance.
Tool configuration incomplete: toolReferences arrays are empty in AAVA 2.0, potentially indicating incomplete migration or configuration.
Agent identification type change: agentName (string) replaced with agentId (integer) + name (string) for enhanced referential integrity.
Workflow ID constraint change: workflowId direct integer access replaced with nested workFlowDetail.id access pattern.
Schema normalization: AAVA 2.0 adopts more normalized structure with separate identification and metadata concerns.
Agent-centric evolution: structural changes indicate shift from task-oriented to agent-oriented metadata model.
Backward compatibility risk: structural changes may break existing parsers expecting workflowId and nodes properties.
Integration risk: missing expectedOutput specifications may impact downstream validation and code generation systems.
Tool configuration risk: empty toolReferences may indicate incomplete agent configuration or migration issues.
AAVA 1.0 JSON syntax valid: well-formed structure with consistent property naming and data types.
Internal consistency maintained: all agent references and tool configurations properly structured.
AAVA 2.0 JSON syntax valid: well-formed structure with enhanced normalization.
Minor inconsistency: workFlowDetail uses camelCase while workflowAgents uses different casing pattern.
Potential configuration issue: all toolReferences arrays empty, may indicate incomplete setup.
Content preservation: agent descriptions remain identical between versions, maintaining functional specifications.
Model upgrade: consistent upgrade from gpt-4 to gpt-4.1 across all agents indicates platform evolution.
Migration status unclear: empty toolReferences could indicate intentional removal or incomplete migration process.
